intro: Nauclea triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered nauclea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Nigeria and Ghana. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, clustered in small umbels, and it produces small, round fruits that contain several seeds. Nauclea triflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
